problem: Given that $33^{-1} \equiv 77 \pmod{508}$, find $11^{-1} \pmod{508}$ as a residue modulo 508.  (Give an answer between 0 and 507, inclusive.)
model_solution:
Step 1:  We are given that $33^{-1} \equiv 77 \pmod{508}$. Our goal is to find $11^{-1} \pmod{508}$ as a residue modulo 508. To do this, we need to utilize the relationship between $33$ and $11$ to derive $11^{-1} \pmod{508}$.
$11 = 3 \times 11 - 2 \times 3 \times 11 = 3 \times 11 - 2 \times 33$
$11 \equiv 2 \times 33 \pmod{508}$
Step 2: $11^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 33)^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 33)^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 77)^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 77)^{-1} \pmod{508}$
Step 3:  Since $2^{-1} \equiv 254 \pmod{508}$ and $77 \times 254 \equiv 19366 \pmod{508}$, we can simplify the expression for $11^{-1}$ as follows: 
$11^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 77)^{-1} \equiv (2^{-1} \times 77)^{-1} \equiv (254 \times 77)^{-1} \equiv 19366^{-1} \pmod{508}$
$19366 \equiv 82 \pmod{508}$
$11^{-1} \equiv 82^{-1} \equiv -26 \equiv 482 \pmod{508}$
$11^{-1} \equiv 82^{-1} \equiv -26 \equiv 482 \pmod{508}$

full_steps:
Step 1:  We are given that $33^{-1} \equiv 77 \pmod{508}$. Our goal is to find $11^{-1} \pmod{508}$ as a residue modulo 508. To do this, we need to utilize the relationship between $33$ and $11$ to derive $11^{-1} \pmod{508}$.
$11 = 3 \times 11 - 2 \times 3 \times 11 = 3 \times 11 - 2 \times 33$
$11 \equiv 2 \times 33 \pmod{508}$

Step 3:  Since $2^{-1} \equiv 254 \pmod{508}$ and $77 \times 254 \equiv 19366 \pmod{508}$, we can simplify the expression for $11^{-1}$ as follows: 
$11^{-1} \equiv (2 \times 77)^{-1} \equiv (2^{-1} \times 77)^{-1} \equiv (254 \times 77)^{-1} \equiv 19366^{-1} \pmod{508}$
$19366 \equiv 82 \pmod{508}$
